question: Well then, what kind of exercise do you usually do?
transcript: I usually do biking and swimming, which are my two favorite exercises. I usually bike from my house to school every day for the past five years. And I also enjoy swimming on the weekends.

anti_overrating.reason: 'usually bike... for the past five years' (have biked). 'do biking' (go biking).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.

question: Do you prefer to exercise alone or with others?
transcript: From the two sports I have mentioned, you can probably guess that I enjoy doing sports alone. Because when you are by yourself, you can have time to think about your plans for the day. And also revise everything about your life from your work to your relationships. And just contemplate on like how great you are to have received a life like this.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: Is exercise a popular activity in your country?
transcript: Oh, absolutely yes. The Vietnamese people love football. And if you go to any park in Ho Chi Minh City, you will find people kicking around shuttlecocks and also playing badminton. Because we as Vietnamese people, we value our health a lot.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: The majority of sentences are error free.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: Khoa, what kind of food do you enjoy eating?
transcript: I enjoy eating many types of meat but my favorite of which is chicken. I usually enjoy fried chicken because of the crispy texture and also how flavorful it is. I can vividly remember the first time my family took me to KFC when I was six years old.. Fried chicken was something really strange to me and I did not quite like it at first. But over time, I developed a sense of..a sense of love for the meat and it has been my favorite food ever since.

anti_overrating.reason: 'sense of love for the meat' (unnatural - love for it / developed a taste for it).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: Tell me, do you often eat out or cook at home?
transcript: It depends on the occasion of the week. My family will usually gather around and have a great family meal from Monday to Friday. However on Saturday to Sunday we celebrate our weekend by usually going out to restaurants We went to a stunning restaurant in District 1 and ate steak Nice Lucky you

anti_overrating.reason: 'occasion of the week' (day of the week).

question: Tell me, is it always easy to give advice?
transcript: I think most definitely not. But it also depends on the situation that you need to give any advice on. For example, if you, if someone asks you on how to, on advice on how to fix your bike, it would be really easy for you. To give them. However, for situations such as giving advice to people in a heartbreak or in depression, it would be much, much harder because these people are experiencing extreme, extreme emotional distress. And as fellow human beings, we must think, we must brainstorm a lot on how to care for our friends, our family who are in these situations.

anti_overrating.reason: 'asks you on how to' (asks you how to). 'advice to people in a heartbreak' (experiencing heartbreak).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: Do young people today listen to advice from the older generation?
transcript: I think it is, it also depends on which kind of advice that the older generations give to the young, the younger ones. For example, we young people always listen to advices on stranger danger. We do not go, we always listen to our parents about advices on not going out all alone or in the dark at night.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.

question: However, I believe that over time, the living conditions from each generation differ to each other and some advices do not hold true anymore.
transcript: For example, there are many cultural practices that are now not as acceptable as it was. For example, eating dogs. Okay, thank you. Interesting.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.

question: In what situations do people usually ask for advice?
transcript: I believe in most cases people ask for advice because they are in need of help. For example, you would ask a doctor how to take care of your health, how to treat this disease, And you would ask your teacher on how to study this material, for example. And there are cases where you would ask your friend or your family how to deal with this trauma you have.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: And finally, is professional advice more valuable than personal advice?
transcript: some people believe that personal advice trumps over professional advice because of how we, how we are so intimately related to each other. Well I believe that professional professional advice still has much more value than personal advice because when you the advice you are given is from people who have studied the language People who have studied a lot on this matter People who have dealt with it have ex more experience with the matter that you dealing with So I believe that at the end of the day, their advice holds more information than people who might not have that much experience, even though they are closely related to you. Thank you. Well done. And Kwa, that brings us to the end of the test.

vocab_evidence: at the end of the day

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: How did you find the test experience?
transcript: I find it quite anxious. Yeah. Mentally taxing.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: So can you see the intonation in my voice that rise and fall?
transcript: And you have that in class, but, and you have it in the test as well. But just sometimes, yeah, when you are scared. I feel like the anxiety has shut off the intonation. Yeah, but I have to compliment you.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: Tell me, where is your hometown?
transcript: I was born and raised in the thriving metropolis, Ho Chi Minh City. which is located in the south of Vietnam as it is a state of the art urban area. So lots of people live there. there is a really busy, lively and fast paced lifestyle. Fantastic.

vocabulary.why_not_9: 'state of the art' usually for tech/buildings, but acceptable. 'thriving metropolis' - excellent.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: The majority of sentences are error free.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses less common and idiomatic vocabulary skilfully.

question: What do you like most about your hometown?
transcript: Oh, there are various things I love about it. Firstly, there are many job opportunities to work in prestigious companies, which is really important because people can earn a high salary and have a better quality of life. Secondly, there is the world-class education system. Therefore, students can develop and learn their skills in a high standard learning environment. Wonderful. that is wonderful.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: The majority of sentences are error free.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses less common and idiomatic vocabulary skilfully.

question: Has your hometown changed much over the years?
transcript: Absolutely. the most common vehicle in my city was bike. I mean, most people cycle to work and, to work and go to school. But now, as you can see, most people use motorbike to move around the city. Oh yes, and moreover, it was much cleaner as there were more parks and gardens, but now they are replaced by factories and buildings because of the industrialization. Fantastic, thank you. And the final question for hometown.

anti_overrating.reason: 'was bike' (was the bike / were bikes). 'use motorbike' (use motorbikes).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.

question: Is there anything you would like to improve about your hometown?
transcript: There are two things I would like to change about my hometown. The first one is, the air quality. I mean, as you know, most people, the majority of people use their personal vehicle, especially motorbike, which release films directly to the air, causing air pollution. And the second one is noise pollution. There is a lot of, a lot of noise from factories as well as karaoke, which badly affects my life. So I want the government to have some, to do something to do with these problems. Wonderful.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: Tell me, Miss Nhi, what time do you usually wake up?
transcript: I would say that it depends on the day. In weekdays, I usually wake up at 6am as I need to go to school early in the morning. But at weekend, I always wake up at 9am as I sleep more because I want to recharge my batteries after a hard week. Fantastic.

anti_overrating.reason: 'In weekdays' (On weekdays). 'at weekend' (at the weekend / on weekends).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: Do you prefer to have a fixed routine or a flexible one?
transcript: Oh, that is an interesting question. I think that I am keen on a flexible routine because of two main reasons. The first one is I cannot predict the future. So I, oh, I usually adjust my work to suit the situation. And the second one is I, it depends on my energy levels of that day. I mean some days I feel really tired so I do less work on that day and we do more in another day when I more energetic Wonderful How fascinating Brilliant What part of the day do you enjoy most I think that I enjoy myself most in late evening around 9 to 10pm when I finish all my homework and I can use social media such as TikTok or chat with friends So, I was with a fresh and comfortable mind and at that time I feel really happy and relaxed. that is wonderful, fantastic.

anti_overrating.reason: 'when I more energetic' (when I am more energetic).

question: And finally, has your routine changed recently?
transcript: Changed? Oh, absolutely yes. I usually spend two or three hours a day to finish all my assignments. And go to bed around 10.30 p.m. But since this Monday, it took me four, five, or even six hours a day to finish all my tasks as well as revise the lessons. And definitely I went to bed later around 11 at midnight to prepare for my final term exams two weeks later. it, it made me a little, sometimes it made me a little bit exhausted, but I think it is worth it as I think that when I learn and revise more, I will pass the exam with flying colors and my present, and my parents will proud of me. Fantastic. that is the main thing. Okay, Ni, I really enjoyed that, listening about your daily routine in the hometown. And.
